author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Jack Wittels, Eric Martin
description: Environmentalists eager to curb planet-warming pollution from shipping had grown increasingly confident that countries would adopt the first-ever global tax on emissions this year.
title: How Trump Pressured Nations to Delay a Carbon Tax on Shipping

author: William Horobin
description: S&P Global Ratings downgraded France, dealing another blow to the country’s credibility as a weakened minority government struggles to pass legislation to tackle a swelling debt burden.
title: France’s Gets Debt Warning as S&P Downgrades in Unscheduled Move

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump said he was commuting the sentence of former Republican lawmaker George Santos, who was convicted and sentenced to prison for stealing campaign funds.
title: Trump Commutes Sentence of Former GOP Lawmaker George Santos

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Skylar Woodhouse
description: The Trump administration formally imposed 25% tariffs on imported medium and heavy-duty trucks and parts, as well as a 10% duty on buses, while extending a key tariff reprieve for American automakers.
title: Trump Extends Auto Tariff Relief, Imposes Truck and Bus Duties

author: Bailey Lipschultz, Annie Massa
description: A blank-check vehicle that counts Donald Trump Jr., investor Chamath Palihapitiya and Fox News host Laura Ingraham among its board members is seeking to raise $260 million in an initial public offering.
title: Trump Jr.’s Firm Taps Palihapitya, GOP Influencers for New SPAC

author: Zoe Tillman
description: The Treasury Department and several other federal agencies told a US judge that her order temporarily halting layoffs tied to the government shutdown doesn’t apply to more than 2,000 employees who have already received firing notices.
title: US Agencies Say Judge’s Order Won’t Stop Some Shutdown Layoffs

author: Lauren Dezenski
description: The president threatens escalation before retreating from brink
title: Trump Leans on Familiar Dealmaking Formula With Xi and Putin

author: Brody Ford, Biz Carson
description: Salesforce Inc. Chief Executive Officer Marc Benioff apologized for calling on President Donald Trump to send the National Guard to San Francisco, after almost a week of public criticism from local allies and government officials for his statements.
title: Salesforce’s Benioff Apologizes for Pro-Trump National Guard Comments

author: Alessandra Migliaccio, Craig Stirling
description: Italy regained its highest score from any major credit assessor since 2018 after an upgrade by Morningstar DBRS that commended the government’s push to tame the budget deficit.
title: Meloni Wins Italy’s Best Rating Since 2018 With DBRS Upgrade

author: Greg Stohr
description: President Donald Trump asked the US Supreme Court to let him immediately deploy National Guard troops in Chicago, escalating a high-stakes clash over his use of the military in American cities.
title: Trump Asks Supreme Court to Let Him Deploy Troops in Chicago

author: Rick Clough
description: A special envoy to Russian President Vladimir Putin called on Elon Musk to build a tunnel between Alaska and Russia’s remote Far East, reviving a decades-old notion at a time when the Kremlin is seeking to bolster ties with the White House.
title: Putin Envoy Woos Musk With Proposal for Russia-to-US Tunnel

author: Courtney McBride
description: President Donald Trump said the US military struck a submarine designed for drug trafficking, amid reports that some aboard the vessel had survived — a first in the administration’s offensive against purported narco-traffickers.
title: Trump Says US Military Struck Submarine Ferrying Drugs

author: Gregory Korte
description: The US Army Corps of Engineers will pause $11 billion in infrastructure projects in 12 states that voted for Democrat Kamala Harris in 2024 as the White House continues to exert leverage in talks to end a government shutdown now in its 17th day.
title: US Pauses $11 Billion of Projects Across Harris-Voting States

author: Mark Niquette, Nazmul Ahasan
description: US federal workers filed the most applications for unemployment benefits since the last government shutdown, according to the latest Labor Department data.
title: Federal Workers File Most Jobless Claims Since Last Shutdown

author: Enda Curran
description: Finance chiefs from around the world wrapped up talks this week resigned to the reality that trade tensions, geopolitical mistrust and the euphoria over the US-led boom in artificial intelligence all pose increasingly entrenched risks to the global economy.
title: Global Finance Chiefs Urged to Keep Calm as Trade War Escalates

author: Liam Knox
description: White House officials are meeting Friday with the leaders of several colleges that have yet to respond to the Trump administration’s proposed preferential funding compact, as well as with representatives of additional schools, according to a person familiar with discussions.
title: White House to Meet College Leaders About Preferential Funding Plan

author: Aliaksandr Kudrytski, Kate Sullivan, Josh Wingrove
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy urged US President Donald Trump to use momentum from the Gaza ceasefire last week to bring an end to Russia’s invasion, part of a trip where he’s seeking Tomahawk missiles and security guarantees.
title: Zelenskiy Seeks Fresh Promise from Trump to End Russia Invasion

author: Maxwell Adler
description: Los Angeles County reached a tentative agreement to pay an additional $828 million to victims of childhood sexual abuse who filed lawsuits under a 2019 state law that raised the statute of limitations for such cases.
title: LA County Reaches New $828 Million Deal With Abuse Victims

author: Tom Rees
description: Rachel Reeves gave her clearest signal yet that she will boost her wafer-thin fiscal buffer when she delivers the UK’s annual budget next month.
title: Rachel Reeves Hints She’ll Boost UK’s Fiscal Buffer at Budget

author: Nacha Cattan
description: New York Mayor Eric Adams is considering a slate of appointments that could wield the power to block parts of mayoral front-runner Zohran Mamdani’s agenda.
title: NYC’s Adams Weighs Stacking Rent Board, Risking Mamdani Priority

author: Volodymyr Verbianyi
description: Ukraine’s central bank is coming under pressure from the International Monetary Fund to devalue the war-battered nation’s currency, a proposal that risks triggering tension in Kyiv ahead of crucial talks on a new loan package.
title: Ukraine Faces IMF Pressure to Devalue Ahead of New Loan Talks

author: Emma Sanchez
description: The leader of the shale fracker founded by US President Donald Trump’s energy secretary blasted tariffs on steel and other oilfield staples, calling them inefficient and bad for business.
title: CEO of Fracker Founded by Trump’s Energy Boss Pans Tariffs

author: Arne Delfs, Patrick Sykes
description: German Foreign Minister Johann Wadephul backed expanded defense industry cooperation with Turkey, shifting Germany to a less restrictive stance on military exports to its fellow NATO member.
title: Germany Signals Easing of Military Restrictions on Turkey

author: Patricia Hurtado
description: Luigi Mangione’s lawyers said his federal death penalty case should be dismissed because comments made by President Donald Trump, Attorney General Pam Bondi and other top officials have damaged his ability to get a fair trial.
title: Mangione Seeks to Toss US Murder Charges Over Trump Comments

author: Samy Adghirni, Jan Bratanic, Andrea Palasciano
description: European leaders are scrambling for a seat at the negotiating table again after Vladimir Putin’s latest contact with Donald Trump threatened to unravel their efforts to intensify pressure on Russia over the war in Ukraine.
title: European Leaders Look for Ways to Sway Trump at New Putin Summit

author: Godfrey Marawanyika
description: Zimbabwean President Emmerson Mnangagwa dismissed reports of divisions within his party over whether he or his second-in-command should lead the southern African nation after the next elections.
title: Zimbabwe Leader Claims Party Unity Amid Reports of Rift With Deputy

author: Ari Natter, Charles Gorrivan
description: America will have to wait for the new creamy version of Magic Rabbit chocolate and peanut butter flavored whiskey.
title: Blame the US Shutdown for Missing the Newest Seasonal Craft Beers and Spirits

author: Kamil Kowalcze, Alessandra Migliaccio
description: German Finance Minister Lars Klingbeil criticized China’s decision to tighten export controls on rare earths and expressed hope for a de-escalation following the meeting between US President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping.
title: German Finance Chief Slams China’s Rare-Earth Export Limits

author: Walter Brandimarte, Patrick Gillespie
description: Javier Milei won Argentina’s presidential election in 2023 as voters bet that his radical economic proposals were what Argentina needed to emerge from decades of instability. Nearly two years later, despite some economic successes, the country has been plunged yet again into crisis, after Milei’s libertarian party’s poor showing in a provincial election in early September sparked doubts about his ability to steer the country and address a continual cycle of economic woe.
title: How Trump Came to Milei’s Rescue Ahead of Argentina’s Election

author: Shruti Srivastava
description: India is trying to find a way to maintain ties with both the US and Russia as it seeks to clinch a trade deal with President Donald Trump and bring down tariff rates of 50%.
title: India Tries to Balance US, Russia Ties in Pursuit of Trump Deal

author: Erik Larson
description: President Donald Trump refiled a streamlined version of his $15 billion defamation lawsuit against the New York Times, stripping out the “repetitive,” “superfluous” and “florid” allegations and details that resulted in a federal judge tossing it out last month.
title: Trump Refiles Shorter NYT Lawsuit Judge Blasted as Too Long

author: Laura Nahmias
description: Democratic candidate for Mayor Zohran Mamdani and former New York Governor Andrew Cuomo debated their positions on Israel, experience in government and how they would handle President Donald Trump in a two-hour televised debate Thursday night.
title: Mamdani, Cuomo Battle Over Crime, Israel in NYC Mayor Debate

author: Patrick Gillespie, Nicolle Yapur
description: Argentina’s peso weakened Friday, even after Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent announced that the US bought the currency the day before on the parallel exchange rate known among investors as the “blue chip swap.”
title: Argentina’s Peso Falls After US Treasury Intervenes Again

author: Andras Gergely, Marton Kasnyik
description: Viktor Orban has been handed a moment in the global spotlight, and with it an opportunity to lift his campaign for re-election in Hungary next year.
title: Orban’s Re-Election Hopes Get a Shot in Arm From Trump and Putin

author: Lauren Dezenski
description: President Donald Trump said high threatened tariffs with China were not viable as tensions between the world’s two largest economies intensify ahead of an expected face-to-face meeting with Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping.
title: Trump Says Threatened High Tariffs on China ‘Not Sustainable’

author: Maciej Martewicz
description: A Polish court declined to extradite to Germany a Ukrainian national suspected of helping sabotage the Nord Stream gas link, saying the destruction of the pipeline was justified by Russia’s attack on Ukraine.
title: Poland Denies Extradition of Nord Stream Suspect to Germany

author: Carolina Gonzalez
description: Over-zealous officials in Chile have admitted they double counted inflation when setting electricity rates. That confession sent price-growth expectations for a year ahead below the target 3%, and led the energy minister to lose his job.
title: Chile’s $117 Million Snafu Sends Inflation Expectations Lower

author: John Harney, Lauren Dezenski
description: President Donald Trump said the government shutdown had given him license to eliminate “a $20 billion project” in Senate Democratic Leader Chuck Schumer’s home state of New York, without specifying which one.
title: Trump Says $20 Billion Project Schumer Wants Is ‘Pretty Much Dead’

author: Chandra Asmara, Grace Sihombing
description: Indonesia will distribute an additional 30 trillion rupiah ($1.8 billion) in cash aid, intensifying efforts to spur consumer spending amid increasing anxiety over the weak job market and tepid wage growth.
title: Indonesia Adds $1.8 Billion of Cash Handouts in Latest Stimulus

author: Anthony Halpin
description: A diplomatic failure might finally tilt the US president into supporting robust pressure on the Russian leader.
title: Putin Faces a Risky Summit Sequel With Trump

author: John Liu, Jing Li, Josh Xiao
description: China has expelled two of the country’s most senior military officials from the Communist Party, including a member of the Politburo, as President Xi Jinping widens his anti-corruption drive.
title: China Ousts Top Military Officials as Xi Widens Graft Purge

author: Ugur Yilmaz
description: A former deputy governor of Turkey’s central bank, Emrah Sener, was among eight people arrested in an investigation into alleged financial irregularities, local broadcaster Halk TV reported.
title: Former Turkish Central Bank Deputy Governor Arrested, Halk Says

author: Sergio Mendoza, Zijia Song
description: Bolivia’s presidential election Sunday will bring an end to two decades of rule by a socialist government that ran the economy into the ground. But the giddiness of voters and investors over the prospects of change will soon give way to the reality of a difficult turnaround.
title: A Post-Socialist Bolivia Will Face Major Economic Test After Runoff Vote

author: Shona Ghosh
description: OpenAI has paused depictions of Martin Luther King Jr. after users generated “disrespectful” deepfake videos of the civil rights leader using its artificial intelligence tool Sora.
title: OpenAI Halts Depictions of MLK After ‘Disrespectful’ Videos

author: Kamlesh Bhuckory
description: Army Colonel Michael Randrianirina was sworn in as Madagascar’s new president on Friday, cementing his hold on power after a military takeover.
title: Madagascar’s Military Leader Sworn in as President After Takeover

author: Philip Glamann
description: China slammed a fresh delay to the UK’s decision on plans for a sprawling new Chinese embassy in central London, warning of unspecified “consequences” if the building isn’t given the go-ahead.
title: China Warns UK of ‘Consequences’ If London Embassy Rejected

author: Alexander Weber, Mark Schroers, Jana Randow
description: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde has taken her mantra that interest rates are in a “good place” to Washington and received backup from nearly all her colleagues that also made the trip.
title: ECB Agrees Policy Is in Good Place as Thoughts on Future Diverge

author: Sakura Murakami, Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Sanae Takaichi, the leader of Japan’s ruling Liberal Democratic Party, is largely on track to become prime minister after a potential ally abandoned opposition efforts to build a rival coalition.
title: Japan’s Takaichi Closes In on Premiership After Talks Progress
